Dear Mr. Alward:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
June 10, 2020. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule.
 Repeat violations must include an explanation of why the previous
corrective action plan did not result in compliance.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of inspection
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 552-3662.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.10113 Employee records.
Employee records shall be maintained for each employee and
shall include all of the following information:
(f) A written evaluation of the employee's performance within
the first 6 months of each position designated by these rules
and annually thereafter.
Three of seventeen employee files reviewed lacked employee written evaluations as
required. One of those three files the evaluation was not completed and two of those
three files the evaluations were completed late.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
Interim Inspection Report dated 06/20/19, CAP approval date 07/01/2019
Renewal Inspection Report dated 06/06/2019, CAP approval date 06/26/2018
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility is in
compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the following:
This is a non-contracted facility; therefore MISEP does not apply.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS Contract/Policy
requirements except for the following:
This is a non-contracted facility.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was not in need of consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
4

The facility has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period in response to the 2019 Interim Inspection.
The facility implemented the corrective action plan successfully regarding resident
files as all files reviewed during this period under review were completed timely.
Additionally, all required signatures were obtained. The facility did have a repeat
violation for completion of employee written evaluations that will need to be
addressed so further citations are not received.
A virtual tour via video conference was completed. The facility was observed to be
clean and well maintained. Ample staff were present and observed to be supervising
the residents. Residents were completing schoolwork in the milieu area of their pods
during the tour. Staff were observed wearing face mask as required due to COVID
19.
During staff interviews staff reported feeling both staff and residents are safe at the
facility and supervision is provided as required. Staff are given ample training
opportunities and feel supported by management. Residents indicated they
participate in a variety of recreational and education activities including life skill
building. Residents reported feeling safe at the facility. Both staff and residents
interviewed stated residents are only restrained after staff have attempted to verbally
deescalate the situation first and is used as a last resort. Neither staff nor residents
indicated concerns with restraints they observed or participated in.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is
recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
